title: Front ABS Wheel Speed Sensor - Removal

body.body: Front ABS Wheel Speed Sensor - Removal
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note the routing of the front ABS wheel speed sensor harness and its retaining clips for installation.
The front ABS wheel speed sensor multiplug is identified as the white connector located above the camshaft cover, near the left hand side.
Disconnect the front ABS wheel speed sensor multiplug from the main harness.
Route the sensor harness down to the front brake caliper.
Detach the sensor harness from the clips on the left front brake line.
Release the fixing, detach the wheel speed sensor harness and remove its conduit. Discard the fixing.
There is a shim between the wheel speed sensor and the front fork leg.
Release the fixing securing the sensor to the fork leg.
Remove the sensor and collect the shim.

Perform the following operations:
Seat - Removal
Battery - Removal
Front Wheel - Removal
Fuel Tank - Removal

Conduit

Remove the sensor and collect the shim.
Fixing
Shim
Clip (one of three)
